data.title: List of USVI TV
data.meta_description: The list "USVI TV" has been viewed 0 times.
data.text:
Caribbean Broadcast Network Television station in Road Town, British Virgin Islands

0 0

rank #1 ·

The Caribbean Broadcast Network (CBN) is the local television station for Road Town, and the rest of the British Virgin Islands. Owned locally by Caribbean Broadcast Network (BVI) Limited, the station broadcasts a 24-hour schedule of local entertainment, news, sports and religious programming, along with infomercials and movies.

WZVI Independent TV station in Charlotte Amalie, U.S. Virgin Islands

0 0

rank #2 ·

WZVI, virtual and UHF digital channel 21, is an Independent television station serving the United States Virgin Islands that is licensed to Charlotte Amalie, Saint Thomas. The station is owned by Atlas News and Information Services, as part of a duopoly with Christiansted-licensed Ion Television affiliate WSVI (channel 8). The two stations share studios at the Sunny Isle Shopping Center in Christiansted; WZVI's transmitter is located on Flag Hill. WZVI serves as a secondary station for the Virgin Islands Television Network.

WVGN-LD NBC affiliate in Charlotte Amalie, US Virgin Islands

0 0

rank #3 ·

WVGN-LD, virtual and UHF digital channel 19, is a low-powered NBC-affiliated television station serving the United States Virgin Islands that is licensed to Charlotte Amalie, Saint Thomas. Owned by Caribbean Broadcasting Network, it is a sister station to dual This TV/Fox affiliate WVXF (channel 17). The two stations share transmitter facilities on Signal Hill.

TV Red Puerto Rico American broadcasting company

0 0

rank #4 ·

TV Red de Puerto Rico, Inc. is a local owner of low-power television stations in Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands. These stations carry programming from English-language and Spanish-language television networks. Headquartered in San Juan, TV Red is one of the largest station groups in Puerto Rico in terms of numbers of stations owned.

TV2 (Virgin Islands) Television station in United States Virgin Islands

0 0

rank #5 ·

TV2 is a cable-only TV channel available on Innovative Cable TV in the United States Virgin Islands. TV2 picked up the CBS network on July 13, 2009, just two weeks after WVXF, the area's previous CBS affiliate, switched from CBS to This TV. TV2's schedule consists entirely of local and syndicated programming.

Television stations in the United States Virgin Islands · 16T

CBS network affiliates · 251T

WJWM-LP Television station in Christiansted, U.S. Virgin Islands

0 0

rank #6 ·

WJWM-LP Is a new station to the U.S. Virgin Islands, being founded on March 3, 2005, along with W35CE, the local TBN affiliate. Its signal, however, does not even cover all of the island of Saint Croix, let alone the other islands.

WEON-LP Television station in Frederiksted, U.S. Virgin Islands

0 0

rank #7 ·

WEON-LP, UHF analog channel 60, was a low-powered Fox-affiliated television station serving the United States Virgin Islands that was licensed to Frederiksted, Saint Croix. Owned by Caribbean Broadcasting Network, it was a sister station to WVGN-LD (channel 19), WVXF (channel 17), and WVGN.

WEYA-LP Television station in Christiansted, U.S. Virgin Islands

0 0

rank #8 ·

WEYA-LP & WEYA-LD are a low-power television stations in Christiansted, U.S. Virgin Islands transmitting over analog channel 52, digital channel 10. The station was founded in 2002 and is owned by Frontline Missions International, Inc.
